intro: Merendera candidissima, commonly known as the white merendera, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in summer. It typically grows in wetlands and marshy areas, preferring moist, well-drained soil. The leaves are ovate and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
